column4: And I can't use a mac to copy the files to a FAT32 volume because... I don't have a mac.
If I had a mac, I'd just network it across.
You see the problem here.
I'm stuffed every way I turn.
So the Linux approach solves many problems.
If someone can confirm to me that I can install the latest version of Ubuntu on a desktop PC, plug the firewire disk in and have a window pop up with its contents, great.
If not, I'll go buy a Mac Mini off Ebay.
That is an interesting idea though.
Especially if... it can write to NTFS disks?
yes it can
unfortunately it doesn't talk to new ipods though
It's short for Janine :)
I used the neuter he :)
now put it in, and see the Flaming Fury :)
depends on the reason
Pretty simple, really - the default resolution seems to be one that the display (an HD LCD TV) doesn't support ("PC-VGA: Out of Range")
probably true. If you know the horizontal sync and vertical refresh of your tv , then that fixres link tells you how to apply them
although another guy was just here with problems with his hd tv, more than just those rates
Well, we would, but there's no actual display to work with.
what kind of video card do you have?
